DOC.brief_summary: This qualitative study will identify which domains are most important to metabolic and bariatric surgical patients, their families/partners, and their caregivers and which valid patient-reported outcome measures (PROMs) will best capture this information. Patient and caregiver feedback will be gathered on the local, regional, and national implementation PROMs in the Metabolic and Bariatric Surgery Accreditation and Quality Improvement Program (MBSAQIP) as well as on patient-reported results and data presentation.
DOC.brief_title: Comparative Effectiveness of Bariatric Surgery With PROMs
DOC.criteria: Metabolic and Bariatric Patient Population Inclusion criteria 1. Adult metabolic and bariatric patients 1. Preoperative patient with bypass, band, or sleeve surgery scheduled within the next 3 months 2. Postoperative patients who had a primary bypass, band, or sleeve procedure without revision within the last 12 months 2. At least 18 years of age 3. English speaker 4. Willingness to return for 7 focus group events over 4 years Exclusion criteria 1. NonEnglish speaking 2. Revised bypass, band or sleeve procedure 3. Immediate family member already enrolled in the study 4. Any postoperative bariatric surgery related complications Patient Partners (family member or close friend) Population Inclusion criteria 1. Any close family member or friend of a pre or postoperative bypass, band, or sleeve surgery patient, e.g. spouse, life partner, adult offspring, parent, adult sibling 2. Willingness to return for 2 focus group events Integrated Caregiver Population Inclusion criteria 1. Any health caregiver having experience working with bariatric patients, e.g. bariatric surgeons, bariatric medical specialists (medical doctor, nurse practitioner, physician's assistant, registered nurse), bariatric psychologists, bariatric dieticians. 2. English speaker 3. Willingness to return for 7 focus group events over 4 years
